fields.description:
We have a large number of (project scope) custom fields (160+), and if you need to change issue field order, the UI isnt optimal.

1) It would be really nice to show the scope of the field - either the project name or issue-type (or "global"). Even nicer would be to "filter" the view, to only show a given project/issue-type custom field.
 
2) There is no way to quickly move a field up or down. The only option is to nudge it 1 at a time. And when you have 160 and counting, that is painfully slow. Some links for +/-10 would be super-cool.

3) System Fields Layout needs to have a big fat red warning (like default dashboard) so that users dont edit the wrong one (easily possible)
fields.summary: Changing Issue Field Order UI is a bit painful when there are large numbers of custom fields

fields.description:
We are using Fisheye with the ViewCVS comapatibility turned on.

Jira creates the following URL:
http://cvs.london.echonet/viewcvs/Development/CPP/SohoFrontOfficeStarter/StdAfx.h?root=SOHO

However, that doesnt work. Replacing root= with cvsroot= does seem to work - ala:
http://cvs.london.echonet/viewcvs/Development/CPP/SohoFrontOfficeStarter/StdAfx.h?cvsroot=SOHO

Our viewcvs only recognises cvsroot= parameter - but it seems newer versions also support root=
We can get Cenqua to support root= - but from your perspective, you might want to either use cvsroot, or add it as a configuration parameter for the cvs module registration.

fields.description:
I want to translate the string

"Restore or backup JIRA data as XML."

into

"Sichern oder Wiederherstellen der JIRA - Daten (XML-Format)."

which is difficult because the string is assembled from many pieces and the structure does not fit the german language. I need the article "der" between "Wiederherstellen" and "JIRA".

It would be much better if you simply use a string like this in the properties, similar to many other places in JIRA:

portlet.admin.data.dataasxml = {0}Restore{2} or {1}backup{2} JIRA data as XML.

See also JRA-4662.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-5982].
  {panel}

We would like to be able to mark an issue open to certain people who would otherwise not have access to it, either through project or issue priority schemes.

What we initially thought we could do was to mark the users as watchers of a particular issue, which would then allow the user to get emails when the issue changes. While this works (apparently due to bug JRA-5743), it doesn't allow the user additional access to the issue over time through the web interface. What we would like is an additional option on the Issue Security Scheme to support allowing anyone marked as a watcher of an issue to be able to be in a security level.

The particular use case is:
- User submits a "help desk" request. This goes to the "Help Desk" project
- The Help Desk project has a "Reporters and Developers" issue security system
- Developer realizes that this requires development (rather than just a quick fix) and is already being tracked by an issue in the "Core" project
- Developer marks the "Help Desk" issue as a duplicate of the "Core" issue and makes the original reporter of the "Help Desk" issue a watcher on the "Core" issue
- From here, while the reporter would otherwise not be able to see anything in the "Core" project, because a developer has made him watch that issue, he should be able to see it.

This was originally tracked in the Atlassian support system as JSP-864.
fields.summary: Watcher Issue Security Field

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-5967].
  {panel}

I order that the statuses appear under the the Project Summary section of the project screen appears to be sorted by the internal status id.  Ideally, the order should be based on the step order for the workflow. 

For example, the custiom workflow that I have implemented has the following steps:
Raised
Assessed
Open
In Progress
Resolved
Pending QA
Pending UAT
Closed

As the workflow reuses exisitng statuses of Open, In Progress, Resolved and Closed, the Project Summary is disaplayed as:

Project Summary
Open
In Progress
Resolved
Closed
Raised
Assessed
Pending QA
Pending UAT

If this was order by the steps rather than the status id, it would be order thus:

Project Summary
Raised
Assessed
Open
In Progress
Resolved
Pending QA
Pending UAT
Closed
fields.summary: Order that statuses appear under the Project Summary with a custom workflow

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-5963].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 22 April 2015|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9 | titleBGColor=#ebf2f9 | bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

Thanks for voting and commenting on this issue. Your input in the comments helps us understand how this affects you and what you're hoping to accomplish with JIRA.

At this time, this suggestion is not on the JIRA development roadmap. Please remember that jira.atlassian.com is one of many inputs for the JIRA roadmap. You can [learn more about our process here|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/110373/how-does-the-jira-team-use-jira-atlassian-com].

I understand that our decision may be disappointing. Please don't hesitate to contact me if you have any questions.

Regards,
Dave Meyer
[dmeyer@atlassian.com|mailto:dmeyer@atlassian.com]
Product Manager, JIRA Platform
{panel}

Summary:
  Version Control File Attachments

Overview:
  I suggest that JIRA should store multiple versions of a file attachment.   When users attach a file of the same name as an existing file, the new file is accepted and previous versions stored.  Users can download an either version, delete individual versions, or delete the whole file object (all versions).

Justification:
  Although JIRA may be considered a bug tracking system, it's often used as a Project Managment tool.  Our current process defines an elaborate change request process, the outcome of which is a word document.  (Personally, I prefer a web form like this!)  And, as in so many things, the spec changes 1/2 way through the project.  The spec document itself is in some CMS, but we always attach it to the root incident for a project for handy reference.  
  Sometimes early decisions can only be explained in context of the previous version of the spec.  Having both handy in JIRA would be a time saver.  Linking to the CMS is another approach, but there are many version of the document as it changes and before it gets turned over to development.
  Although JIRA is not a replacement for a version control or content management system, this feature request seems to track when JIRA is used to consolidate project information.

Possible future directions:
  Allow saving a new version with webdav.

Dependencies:
  In my opinion it's acceptable to require a CVS backend for this functionality.  Preferred would be to store in the JIRA tables.

Thanks,
Darren.
fields.summary: Version Control File Attachments

fields.description: I happened to have an issue whose description contained XML code, a it was explaining an XML related issue. I exported the JIRA database to XML, and when editing it, my XML editor advised me it was not well formed. I figured out the problem was because it was interpreting description content like CDATA tags as real XML content. You'll notice how HTML codes are escaped (like &reg etc.) so as not to confuse HTML parsers. The same should have been done for XML-like text before dumping to XML output. If I hadn't noticed this, I probably would have gotten an error importing my XML backup into JIRA. I was able to fix this by editing the data in my XML file, but I was just lucky my editor flagged this and I was able to catch this before trying to upload. JIRA should be able to encode and decode XML-like content. I can't expect users won't enter XML code into their issue description. In fact.. I could do it right here which would render your XML backups problematic too .. but I won't :)
fields.summary: XML content not encoded in XML output

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-5948].
  {panel}

I have stumbled upon a problem in customizing the workflow in JIRA.  

The workflow that we would like to implement will following throught he following steps:
Raised
Assessed
Open / In Progress
Resolved
Pending QA
Pending UAT
Closed

For more details about the workflow refer to the attached graphic image.

The problem is that once issues have been resolved and a resolution entered by the developer (step 4), JIRA will treat the issue as not open.  It disappers from the "Open Isues" summary on the project screen and the issue will display as green in the progress status bar of the Roadmap. I assume this is because the issue has had a resilution entered.

There are a number of ways JIRA could be improbved to cater for this.  One possibility is to specify whether the step is Open or Closed when setting up the workflow.  This would mean that the current default JIRA workflow will behave as it currently does.
fields.summary: Handling of Resolved issues under a custom workflow

fields.description:
JIRA 3.1 tries to check that the database type specified in WEB-INF/classes/entityengine.xml is not incorrect with regards to what the JDBC driver reports. If entityengine.xml uses "hsql" and the driver reports "mysql", this is clearly an error. However in the case of SQL Server and Sybase, it gets this check wrong, and JIRA will exit with an error like:

Database type is invalid.  entityengine.xml is configured for 'mssql', but database is indicating 'jTDS JDBC Driver for Microsoft SQL Server and Sybase'.

The mention of 'Sybase' is what throws the check off in this case.
fields.summary: JIRA 3.1 fails to upgrade JIRA 3.0.x data using jTDS driver (SQL Server and Sybase)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-5943].
  {panel}

I couldn't figure out how to hide the security field and still have it default to the only valid security level.
 
I set it to Required, and hidden, but when issues were added (by me), the security level was recorded as  "None". 
 
It looks like I had 2 choices to resolve this:
 
1) unhide the field in order to get it to set the security level to the only valid choice
2) set the permission scheme so that the person entering the issue (me) cannot also set issue security
 
I went with option 2..
 
Do you think that's a bug? i.e. just because I have issue security permissions doesn't mean it shouldn't still pick up the default security level when the field is hidden.
fields.summary: Allow required hidden fields when default value set

fields.description: When receiving an HTML e-mail, I click on the links available to me (e.g. view issue online). Sometimes, it opens a new browser window with the issue displayed. But usually, it tells me I am not logged in and forces me to log in, when in fact I AM logged in (in my other browser window). Why does this not always work?
fields.summary: does not recognize logged in user when viewing issue from email
Cannot attach a file

fields.description:
When viewing issues in the issue navigator, I should be able to click on any column and have it sort by that column.. then click on another column, and have the previous one be the secondary sort, and the just clicked one be the current sort - up to 3 levels.
I have seen this work ... but I cannot figure out why sometimes it works and sometimes it doesn't. When it doesn't work, I only get one sort (no secondary or tertiary sorts). Why would this functionality be intermittent? I haven't been able to find any pattern - with regards to which fields I'm sorting on, custom or not for example. Usually I am clicking on the default saved filter "Resolved" - not a personal or saved filter.
Even as I'm writing this I saw it flip from not working to working. All I did was edit the filter so that the Assigned user was populated (as current user) and it started giving me 3 sort levels again. (Normally all "Resolved" issues are assigned to me so I don't filter on that). Any ideas?

What's more... I clicked on the column headings (the same two) a few times until it generated an error (see attachment). It didn't recur, but I'm attaching the error to this issue anyway.
fields.summary: Issue navigator does not sort by more than one column

fields.description: Trying to upgrade from 3.0 to 3.1 with SQL Server 2000 database. Web interface displays error message: Database type is invalid. entityengine.xml is configured for 'mssql', but database is indicating 'jTDS Type 4 JDBC Driver for MS SQL Server and Sybase'. Please ensure entityengine.xml is correct Which is kind of strange, because this is the correct driver. - entityengine.xml is configured in the same way as for 3.0 - tried upgrading to jtds 1.0.2 with same result - backgrading to 3.0 and everything works again
fields.summary: Database Type Invalid

fields.description: For now, on a transition view we have: Add comment, assign and set resolution choices. It would be interesting to had the possibility to edit somes field on a transition. For example, I've got a transition named "Schedule interview" and I want that the user edit the custom field "interview date" on this transition.
fields.summary: Add to possibility to edit field on transition

fields.description:
I just did a testinstall of the new JIRA 3.1 (#80) and imported all the data from the running system.
Everything works fine so far, just one thing is strange:
When I am on the project site (/secure/BrowseProject.jspa?id=10023), and click on "major" or one of the users on the right, I get a list of issues over all available projects. Not just the one I am browsing at the moment.
In the old (3.0.3; #75) installation the "pid=10023" is set, but in the new Jira 3.1 this URL parameter is empty.
Is this already known? Am I doing something wrong?
Filed as well under JIRA Support: JSP-940
fields.summary: missing pid parameter in BrowseProject

fields.description:
It would be very useful to have a quick search portlet option that would allow users to do key word searches on their filters (or on projects).  As the current quick search searches everything, it gets less and less useful as we add more projects (for example, as all our products have dialog boxes in them, developers can no longer use the quick search to find out about dialog box related issues in their product as there is so much noise).  Being able to search through filters from the dashboard would solve this.

I have attached a UI mock up to show what I mean!
fields.summary: Qucik search projects or filters

fields.description: On the User Profile page http://jira.atlassian.com/secure/ViewProfile.jspa?name=xxx , the user's e-mail address is shown in clear text and thus readable for anyone once registered . Is this wise , when out there are so many "harvesters" collecting e-mail addresses ? Maybe in a future version one could implement a toggle switch for "Show/don't show my full address" ..
fields.summary: E-mail Address is Shown in Clear Text.

fields.description: From the dashboard, if I click on one of the coloured blocks for a project (eg to view all the major bugs), JIRA gives an error message.  See attached bitmap.
fields.summary: Clicking on the coloured bar chart for a project causes an error

fields.description:
On http://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=1035 , it says "the jira.atlassian.com WSDL file is _here_." When clicking on the link for the WSDL file (located at http://jira.atlassian.com/rpc/soap/jiraservice-v1.wsdl) , it says "HTTP 404 - Page not found" . Am I missing something , or is the file just not being served ? 

G.B.
fields.summary: SOAP WSDL File is not being Served.

Filter fails to catch issues for a particular group if the issues were created before the group was created.

It also still catches issues for a group even if that group has been removed.

Jelly AddPermission tag does not flush permission cache

fields.description:
my company has been evaluating JIRA for 4-5 weeks now, and generally we are very impressed. one thing that several people have pointed out is the lack of consistancy when 'drilling down' to an issue.

if i start on the jira home page, and click on my project, i see my project with a breadcrumb link at the top, to go back to the main page, something like this:

Projects : MYPROJECT (Key: MYPROJECT)

if i then click on any of the ways to get to an issue, i loose my home->project path, and am now on the 'find issues' tab.

there is a path back to MYPROJECT, but its not in the same place as the projects breadcrumbs.. so i have to look around to find it.

seems like i should always have a path back up the hiearchy.. something like:

home-> MYPROJECT -> ISSUENAVIGATOR -> MYPROJECT-123, or something like that..

i kinda feel like i'm jumping around without a consistant path to go back to where i was.

anyway, my $0.02

thanks

gareth
fields.summary: more consistant navigation breadcrumbs

fields.description:
When I move the issue from one project to another its subtasks are moved as well and getting new ids in new project. That's very cool. Unfortunately those subtasks are still displayed in original project for example in 'outstanding', or 'all open' filters.
Please take a look at

http://www.jetbrains.net/jira/browse/IDEADEV-28
(IDEADEV - is a new project)

and browse http://www.jetbrains.net/jira/browse/IDEA
(IDEA - is an old project) for 'subversion' word for instance limiting search to IDEA (IntelliJ IDEA Feedback) project only. Those subtasks from IDEADEV-28 are displayed in the search they no longer match.

This is 100% reproducible at least on our Jira installation.
fields.summary: Moved issue subtasks display in 'outstanding' filter over original (old) project

fields.description:
We often find ourseleves creating issues that require the attachment of more than one file.

It would be extremely beneficial if this could be achieved as a single operation rather than a create and mutiple edits.
fields.summary: Attach multiple files on issue creation

fields.description:
Here are the list of SOAP improvements:

New types
---------
+ RemoteEntity    //superclass for users and groups used for PermissionSchemes
+ RemoteGroup
+ RemoteUser
+ RemotePermission
+ RemoteScheme
+ RemotePermissionScheme
                                                                                                                                          
Changed Types
-------------
* RemoteProject
    + RemoteScheme issueSecurityScheme;
        + RemoteScheme permissionScheme;
      + RemoteScheme notificationScheme;
                                                                                                                                          
New features
------------
* IssueService
    + void deleteIssue(User user, String issueKey)
                                                                                                                                          
* ProjectService
    + RemoteProject createProject(User user, String key, String name, String description, String url, String lead, RemotePermissionScheme permissionScheme, RemoteScheme notificationScheme, RemoteScheme issueSecurityScheme)
        + RemoteProject updateProject(User user, RemoteProject rProject)
        + void deleteProject(User user, String projectKey)
                                                                                                                                          
+ SchemeService
    + public RemoteScheme[] getNotificationSchemes(User admin)
        + public RemotePermissionScheme[] getPermissionSchemes(User admin)
        + public RemoteScheme[] getIssueSecuritySchemes(User admin)
        + public RemotePermission[] getAllPermissions(User admin)
        + public RemotePermissionScheme createPermissionScheme(User admin, String name, String description)
        + public RemotePermissionScheme addPermissionTo(User admin, RemotePermissionScheme permissionScheme, RemotePermission remotePermission, RemoteEntity remoteEntity)
        + public RemotePermissionScheme deletePermissionFrom(User admin, RemotePermissionScheme permissionSchemeName, RemotePermission remotePermission, RemoteEntity remoteEntity)
        + public void deletePermissionScheme(User admin, String permissionSchemeName)
                                                                                                                                          
* UserService

fields.description: If a field layout scheme is created with a field (say Environment) is hidden, and this is associated with just one issue type in a project, then that field cannot be searched for in the issue navigator.  We evidently have a bug in the logic where field layout schemes are checked.
fields.summary: If field is hidden for one type, it is not searchable for any

fields.description:
From http://support.atlassian.com/browse/JSP-905

I cloned an issue with sub tasks in project A and than moved the Clone to project B. That means, the sub tasks should be moved to B to. That is shown by the keys of the sub tasks which have right project key prefix. But when I list the road map of project A, the sub tasks are still listed there.

The sub tasks have no fix version selected.
fields.summary: Sub tasks of Moved Issues stay in Road Map
